Description: Rim sherd (consisting of two unjoined fragments) of Corinthian, probably black-figured, pottery column-krater; interior: glazed black with single added red band; on top of rim, frieze of rays (fired red in places); edge of rim, underside and top of neck glazed; band of white dot rosettes on neck.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

For parallels, see Dunbabin, T. J. (ed.) Perachora 2: Pottery, Ivories, Scarabs and Other Objects. The Sanctuaries of Hera Akraia and Limenia. Oxford 1962, pl. 69, fig. 2245. See also British Museum 1886,0401.919.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 217)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 101, no. A151)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.003) (Phase 1)
